page.title: 07A POLICEMAN'S DAY IN OAKHAM
page.content: Oakham's police station is situated on Station Road and has a contingent of 41 officers. The old county of Rutland is the area patrolled by the station, which is part of the Leicestershire Constabulary. This is mainly a rural district. The day is divided into three main shifts; 6am-2pm, 2pm-10pm, 10pm_6am. On each shift there are at least 4 officers: one patrolling Oakham on foot, one in an area car patrolling Rutland and another patrols locally in a car. While the sargeant in charge of the shift stays at the station. Crime presents very few problems in Oakham, the main problem area being the traffic on the A1 and A47 with accidents, particulary in the holiday period.
